title: Iron shoes/zh-CN
data:
**NetHack 中文 Wiki 需要您的帮助！**  
[了解如何帮助我们完善Wiki](/wiki/NetHackWiki:How_to_help/zh-CN "NetHackWiki:How to help/zh-CN")

**[English](/wiki/Iron_shoes "Iron shoes")** • [中文（中国大陆）‎]()

| \[   铁鞋   [![Iron shoes.png](/images/b/b9/Iron_shoes.png)](/wiki/File:Iron_shoes.png) |                                                                                                                 |
| ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| 外观                                                                                    | 硬底鞋                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                       |                                                                                                                 |
| 装备槽位                                                                                  | [靴子](/wiki/%E9%9D%B4%E5%AD%90 "靴子")                                                                             |
| AC                                                                                    | [2](/index.php?title=%E6%8A%A4%E7%94%B2%E7%AD%89%E7%BA%A7\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "护甲等级 (page does not exist)") |
| 特殊效果                                                                                  | *（无）*                                                                                                           |
|                                                                                       |                                                                                                                 |
| 基础价                                                                                   | 16 [zm](/wiki/%E9%87%91%E5%B8%81 "金币")                                                                          |
| 重量                                                                                    | [50](/index.php?title=%E9%87%8D%E9%87%8F\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "重量 (page does not exist)")                    |
| 材料                                                                                    | [铁](/index.php?title=%E9%93%81\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "铁 (page does not exist)")                               |

**铁鞋**（iron shoes）是[NetHack](/index.php?title=NetHack/zh-CN\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "NetHack/zh-CN (page does not exist)")中的一种[靴子](/wiki/%E9%9D%B4%E5%AD%90 "靴子")类[防具](/wiki/%E9%98%B2%E5%85%B7 "防具")。它由[铁](/index.php?title=%E9%93%81\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "铁 (page does not exist)")制成，未[鉴定](/index.php?title=%E9%89%B4%E5%AE%9A\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "鉴定 (page does not exist)")时外观为**硬底鞋**（hard shoes）。

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 生成](#.E7.94.9F.E6.88.90)

- [2 描述](#.E6.8F.8F.E8.BF.B0)

- [3 策略](#.E7.AD.96.E7.95.A5)

- [4 历史](#.E5.8E.86.E5.8F.B2)

- [5 Variants](#Variants)

  - [5.1 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [5.2 xNetHack](#xNetHack)
  - [5.3 EvilHack](#EvilHack)
  - [5.4 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)
  - [5.5 Hack'EM](#Hack.27EM)

- [6 引用及注释](#.E5.BC.95.E7.94.A8.E5.8F.8A.E6.B3.A8.E9.87.8A)

## 生成

非[亡灵](/index.php?title=%E4%BA%A1%E7%81%B5\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "亡灵 (page does not exist)")的[矮人](/index.php?title=%E7%9F%AE%E4%BA%BA%EF%BC%88%E6%80%AA%E7%89%A9%E5%B1%9E%E6%80%A7%EF%BC%89\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "矮人（怪物属性） (page does not exist)")类怪物生成时有6⁄7的概率[获得](/index.php?title=%E6%80%AA%E7%89%A9%E8%B5%B7%E5%A7%8B%E7%89%A9%E5%93%81\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "怪物起始物品 (page does not exist)")一双铁鞋。[强兽人](/index.php?title=%E5%BC%BA%E5%85%BD%E4%BA%BA\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "强兽人 (page does not exist)")生成时有1⁄3的概率获得一双铁鞋[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)。[兽人队长](/index.php?title=%E5%85%BD%E4%BA%BA%E9%98%9F%E9%95%BF\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "兽人队长 (page does not exist)")生成时有1⁄2的概率获得与强兽人相同的起始装备，因此它们生成时有1⁄6的概率获得铁鞋[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)。

在[星界位面](/index.php?title=%E6%98%9F%E7%95%8C%E4%BD%8D%E9%9D%A2\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "星界位面 (page does not exist)")生成的[玩家怪物](/index.php?title=%E7%8E%A9%E5%AE%B6%E6%80%AA%E7%89%A9\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "玩家怪物 (page does not exist)")有约4.68%的概率获得一双铁鞋[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)[\[5\]](#cite_note-mk_mplayer_armor-5)。

## 描述

铁鞋的基础[AC](/index.php?title=AC/zh-CN\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "AC/zh-CN (page does not exist)")加成为2，穿戴时有2⁄5的概率防止穿戴者的腿被[玄蚊](/index.php?title=%E7%8E%84%E8%9A%8A\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "玄蚊 (page does not exist)")叮[伤](/index.php?title=%E8%85%BF%E4%BC%A4\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "腿伤 (page does not exist)")[\[6\]](#cite_note-6)。

## 策略

铁鞋和[高筒靴](/wiki/%E9%AB%98%E7%AD%92%E9%9D%B4 "高筒靴")是游戏中唯二基础AC为2的靴子。铁鞋很容易在[侏儒矿坑](/index.php?title=%E4%BE%8F%E5%84%92%E7%9F%BF%E5%9D%91\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "侏儒矿坑 (page does not exist)")里找到，但更重，且会阻碍[施法](/index.php?title=%E6%96%BD%E6%B3%95\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "施法 (page does not exist)")，还会[生锈](/index.php?title=%E7%94%9F%E9%94%88\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "生锈 (page does not exist)")，因此遇见[锈怪](/index.php?title=%E9%94%88%E6%80%AA\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "锈怪 (page does not exist)")时会比较麻烦。

游戏早期，想尽快降低AC，且不需要依赖施法的近战角色，可以考虑利用矿坑里找到的铁鞋，后续遇到高筒靴时可以考虑替换之。如果不穿其他的金属防具，那么穿铁鞋对低等级法术成功率的惩罚是比较小的。

## 历史

铁鞋最初于[NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0")加入游戏。

## Variants

**此条目或段落的部分内容需要翻译。**  
您可以帮助我们[**翻译此页面**](https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Iron_shoes/zh-CN\&action=edit)，但**请勿使用机器翻译**。

Some variants rename the hard shoes used by dwarves to **dwarvish boots**, which may also grant an AC bonus to dwarves that wear them (including [dwarven](/wiki/Dwarf_\(starting_race\) "Dwarf (starting race)") characters), and are otherwise the same as iron shoes; other variants may additionally repurpose the iron shoes given to Uruk-hai into [orcish boots](/wiki/Orcish_boots "Orcish boots"), which may also grant an AC bonus to orcs that wear them (including [orcish](/wiki/Orc_\(starting_race\) "Orc (starting race)") characters).

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack") and [notnotdNetHack](/wiki/NotnotdNetHack "NotnotdNetHack"), the pair of iron shoes is simply known as a **pair of shoes** and retains its unidentified appearance.

A pair of shoes grants 1 base AC and 1 [DR](/wiki/DR "DR") while worn, and have a base [object material](/wiki/Object_materials_\(dNetHack\) "Object materials (dNetHack)") of iron - a pair of shoes always displays its material when identified, even with the default material.

Several monsters can generate with a pair of shoes:

- [Storm giants](/wiki/Storm_giant "Storm giant") are generated with a pair of iron shoes.
- [Master Kaen](/wiki/Master_Kaen "Master Kaen") is generated with a cursed +4 pair of iron shoes that have the holy, consecrated, unholy, and desecrated [object properties](/wiki/Object_properties#Offensive "Object properties").
- [Eclavdra](/wiki/Eclavdra "Eclavdra"), the [quest leader](/wiki/Quest_leader "Quest leader") for the [Drow Racial quest](/wiki/Drow_Racial_quest "Drow Racial quest") and [Hedrow shared quest](/index.php?title=Hedrow_shared_quest\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Hedrow shared quest (page does not exist)"), is generated with a blessed and erodeproofed +0 pair of [silver](/wiki/Silver "Silver") shoes.
- [Sister T'eirastra](/index.php?title=Sister_T%27eirastra\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Sister T'eirastra (page does not exist)"), the [Drow Healer quest](/index.php?title=Drow_Healer_quest\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Drow Healer quest (page does not exist)") leader, is generated with a blue-colored blessed pair of [cloth](/wiki/Cloth "Cloth") shoes.
- [Pen'a mendicants](/index.php?title=Pen%27a_mendicant\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Pen'a mendicant (page does not exist)") are generated with a blue-colored blessed pair of [cloth](/wiki/Cloth "Cloth") shoes.
- [Neferet the Green](/wiki/Neferet_the_Green "Neferet the Green") is generated with a blessed and erodeproofed +5 pair of silver shoes.
- [Nurses](/wiki/Nurse "Nurse") that are generated in the [Anachrononaut quest](/wiki/Anachrononaut_quest "Anachrononaut quest") and [Android quest](/index.php?title=Android_quest\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Android quest (page does not exist)") are generated with a +7 white-colored pair of cloth shoes.

### xNetHack

[xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack") renames iron shoes to "dwarvish boots" and retains the odds of Uruk-hai generating with them, with a comment in makemon.c suggesting that they stole their boots from dwarves.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), iron shoes are renamed to dwarvish boots and grant a +1 AC bonus to dwarves that wear them, while Uruk-hai and other [orcs](/wiki/Orc_\(monster_class\) "Orc (monster class)") are instead given orcish boots, which grant a +1 AC bonus to orcs wearing them.

[Croesus](/wiki/Croesus "Croesus") has a 1⁄2 chance of generating with a set of [gold](/wiki/Gold_\(material\) "Gold (material)") dwarvish boots.

A pair of dwarvish boots can be created at a [forge](/wiki/Forge_\(dungeon_feature\) "Forge (dungeon feature)") by combining a [dwarvish short sword](/wiki/Dwarvish_short_sword "Dwarvish short sword") and a pair of [gauntlets](/wiki/Gauntlets_\(EvilHack\) "Gauntlets (EvilHack)").

### SlashTHEM

In [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), the [militant cleric](/wiki/Militant_cleric "Militant cleric") of the rebel party that serves as [quest nemeses](/wiki/Quest_nemeses "Quest nemeses") for the default [Noble quest](/wiki/Noble_quest "Noble quest") will generate with iron shoes.

### Hack'EM

[Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM") splits iron shoes into dwarvish and orcish boots similar to EvilHack.

[Upgrading](/wiki/Upgrading "Upgrading") a pair of [high boots](/wiki/High_boots "High boots") will produce a pair of dwarvish boots. As in EvilHack, a pair of dwarvish boots can be created at a forge by combining a dwarvish short sword and a pair of gauntlets.

## 引用及注释

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 417](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/makemon.c#L417)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 370](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/makemon.c#L370)
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 402](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/makemon.c#L402)
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [src/mplayer.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 134](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mplayer.c#L134)
5. [↑](#cite_ref-mk_mplayer_armor_5-0) [src/mplayer.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 294](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mplayer.c#L294)
6. [↑](#cite_ref-6) [src/mhitu.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1220](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mhitu.c#L1220)

[![此条目的内容已同步至NetHack 3.6.7。详细信息请点击此处。](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "此条目的内容已同步至NetHack 3.6.7。详细信息请点击此处。")
html:
Iron shoes/zh-CN

From NetHackWiki
< Iron shoes
Jump to navigation Jump to search

NetHack 中文 Wiki 需要您的帮助！
了解如何帮助我们完善Wiki

English

 • 中文（中国大陆）‎
[   铁鞋  
外观 硬底鞋
装备槽位 靴子
AC 2
特殊效果

（无）

基础价 16 zm
重量 50
材料 铁

铁鞋（iron shoes）是NetHack中的一种靴子类防具。它由铁制成，未鉴定时外观为硬底鞋（hard shoes）。

Contents

  • 1 生成
  • 2 描述
  • 3 策略
  • 4 历史
  • 5 Variants
    • 5.1 dNetHack
    • 5.2 xNetHack
    • 5.3 EvilHack
    • 5.4 SlashTHEM
    • 5.5 Hack'EM
  • 6 引用及注释

生成

非亡灵的矮人类怪物生成时有6⁄7的概率获得一双铁鞋。强兽人生成时有1⁄3的概率获得一双铁鞋[1][2]。兽人队长生成时有1⁄2的概率获得与强兽人相同的起始装备，因此它们生成时有1⁄6的概率获得铁鞋[3]。

在星界位面生成的玩家怪物有约4.68%的概率获得一双铁鞋[4][5]。

描述

铁鞋的基础AC加成为2，穿戴时有2⁄5的概率防止穿戴者的腿被玄蚊叮伤[6]。

策略

铁鞋和高筒靴是游戏中唯二基础AC为2的靴子。铁鞋很容易在侏儒矿坑里找到，但更重，且会阻碍施法，还会生锈，因此遇见锈怪时会比较麻烦。

游戏早期，想尽快降低AC，且不需要依赖施法的近战角色，可以考虑利用矿坑里找到的铁鞋，后续遇到高筒靴时可以考虑替换之。如果不穿其他的金属防具，那么穿铁鞋对低等级法术成功率的惩罚是比较小的。

历史

铁鞋最初于NetHack 3.0.0加入游戏。

Variants

此条目或段落的部分内容需要翻译。
您可以帮助我们翻译此页面，但请勿使用机器翻译。

Some variants rename the hard shoes used by dwarves to dwarvish boots, which may also grant an AC bonus to dwarves that wear them (including dwarven characters), and are otherwise the same as iron shoes; other variants may additionally repurpose the iron shoes given to Uruk-hai into orcish boots, which may also grant an AC bonus to orcs that wear them (including orcish characters).

dNetHack

In dNetHack, notdNetHack and notnotdNetHack, the pair of iron shoes is simply known as a pair of shoes and retains its unidentified appearance.

A pair of shoes grants 1 base AC and 1 DR while worn, and have a base object material of iron - a pair of shoes always displays its material when identified, even with the default material.

Several monsters can generate with a pair of shoes:

  • Storm giants are generated with a pair of iron shoes.
  • Master Kaen is generated with a cursed +4 pair of iron shoes that have the holy, consecrated, unholy, and desecrated object properties.
  • Eclavdra, the quest leader for the Drow Racial quest and Hedrow shared quest, is generated with a blessed and erodeproofed +0 pair of silver shoes.
  • Sister T'eirastra, the Drow Healer quest leader, is generated with a blue-colored blessed pair of cloth shoes.
  • Pen'a mendicants are generated with a blue-colored blessed pair of cloth shoes.
  • Neferet the Green is generated with a blessed and erodeproofed +5 pair of silver shoes.
  • Nurses that are generated in the Anachrononaut quest and Android quest are generated with a +7 white-colored pair of cloth shoes.

xNetHack

xNetHack renames iron shoes to "dwarvish boots" and retains the odds of Uruk-hai generating with them, with a comment in makemon.c suggesting that they stole their boots from dwarves.

EvilHack

In EvilHack, iron shoes are renamed to dwarvish boots and grant a +1 AC bonus to dwarves that wear them, while Uruk-hai and other orcs are instead given orcish boots, which grant a +1 AC bonus to orcs wearing them.

Croesus has a 1⁄2 chance of generating with a set of gold dwarvish boots.

A pair of dwarvish boots can be created at a forge by combining a dwarvish short sword and a pair of gauntlets.

SlashTHEM

In SlashTHEM, the militant cleric of the rebel party that serves as quest nemeses for the default Noble quest will generate with iron shoes.

Hack'EM

Hack'EM splits iron shoes into dwarvish and orcish boots similar to EvilHack.

Upgrading a pair of high boots will produce a pair of dwarvish boots. As in EvilHack, a pair of dwarvish boots can be created at a forge by combining a dwarvish short sword and a pair of gauntlets.

引用及注释

  1. ↑ src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 417
  2. ↑ src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 370
  3. ↑ src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 402
  4. ↑ src/mplayer.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 134
  5. ↑ src/mplayer.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 294
  6. ↑ src/mhitu.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1220

{{needhelp/zh-CN}}
{{languages}}
{{armor/zh-CN
  |color=metal color
  |name=铁鞋
  |appearance=硬底鞋
  |cost=16
  |slot=靴子
  |ac=2
  |weight=50
  |material=铁
}}
'''铁鞋'''（iron shoes）是{{cnlink|NetHack}}中的一种[[靴子]]类[[防具]]。它由[[铁]]制成，未[[鉴定]]时外观为'''硬底鞋'''（hard shoes）。

== 生成 ==
非[[亡灵]]的[[矮人（怪物属性）|矮人]]类怪物生成时有{{frac|6|7}}的概率[[怪物起始物品|获得]]一双铁鞋。[[强兽人]]生成时有{{frac|3}}的概率获得一双铁鞋{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|417|version=NetHack 3.6.7}}{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|370|version=NetHack 3.6.7}}。[[兽人队长]]生成时有{{frac|2}}的概率获得与强兽人相同的起始装备，因此它们生成时有{{frac|6}}的概率获得铁鞋{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|402|version=NetHack 3.6.7}}。

在[[星界位面]]生成的[[玩家怪物]]有约4.68%的概率获得一双铁鞋{{refsrc|src/mplayer.c|134|version=NetHack 3.6.7}}{{refsrc|src/mplayer.c|294|version=NetHack 3.6.7|name=mk_mplayer_armor}}。

== 描述 ==
铁鞋的基础{{cnlink|AC}}加成为2，穿戴时有{{frac|2|5}}的概率防止穿戴者的腿被[[玄蚊]]叮[[腿伤|伤]]{{refsrc|src/mhitu.c|1220|version=NetHack 3.6.7}}。

== 策略 ==
铁鞋和[[高筒靴]]是游戏中唯二基础AC为2的靴子。铁鞋很容易在[[侏儒矿坑]]里找到，但更重，且会阻碍[[施法]]，还会[[生锈]]，因此遇见[[锈怪]]时会比较麻烦。

游戏早期，想尽快降低AC，且不需要依赖施法的近战角色，可以考虑利用矿坑里找到的铁鞋，后续遇到高筒靴时可以考虑替换之。如果不穿其他的金属防具，那么穿铁鞋对低等级法术成功率的惩罚是比较小的。

== 历史 ==
铁鞋最初于[[NetHack 3.0.0]]加入游戏。

==Variants==
{{translation/zh-CN|n}}
Some variants rename the hard shoes used by dwarves to '''dwarvish boots''', which may also grant an AC bonus to dwarves that wear them (including [[Dwarf (starting race)|dwarven]] characters), and are otherwise the same as iron shoes; other variants may additionally repurpose the iron shoes given to Uruk-hai into [[orcish boots]], which may also grant an AC bonus to orcs that wear them (including [[Orc (starting race)|orcish]] characters).

===dNetHack===
In [[dNetHack]], [[notdNetHack]] and [[notnotdNetHack]], the pair of iron shoes is simply known as a '''pair of shoes''' and retains its unidentified appearance.

A pair of shoes grants 1 base AC and 1 [[DR]] while worn, and have a base [[Object materials (dNetHack)|object material]] of iron - a pair of shoes always displays its material when identified, even with the default material.

Several monsters can generate with a pair of shoes:<!--non-exhaustive-->

* [[Storm giant]]s are generated with a pair of iron shoes.
* [[Master Kaen]] is generated with a cursed +4 pair of iron shoes that have the holy, consecrated, unholy, and desecrated [[Object properties#Offensive|object properties]].
* [[Eclavdra]], the [[quest leader]] for the [[Drow Racial quest]] and [[Hedrow shared quest]], is generated with a blessed and erodeproofed +0 pair of [[silver]] shoes.
* [[Sister T'eirastra]], the [[Drow Healer quest]] leader, is generated with a blue-colored blessed pair of [[cloth]] shoes.
* [[Pen'a mendicant]]s are generated with a blue-colored blessed pair of [[cloth]] shoes.
* [[Neferet the Green]] is generated with a blessed and erodeproofed +5 pair of silver shoes.
* [[Nurse]]s that are generated in the [[Anachrononaut quest]] and [[Android quest]] are generated with a +7 white-colored pair of cloth shoes.

===xNetHack===
[[xNetHack]] renames iron shoes to "dwarvish boots" and retains the odds of Uruk-hai generating with them, with a comment in makemon.c suggesting that they stole their boots from dwarves.

===EvilHack===
In [[EvilHack]], iron shoes are renamed to dwarvish boots and grant a +1 AC bonus to dwarves that wear them, while Uruk-hai and other [[Orc (monster class)|orcs]] are instead given orcish boots, which grant a +1 AC bonus to orcs wearing them.

[[Croesus]] has a {{frac|2}} chance of generating with a set of [[Gold (material)|gold]] dwarvish boots.

A pair of dwarvish boots can be created at a [[Forge (dungeon feature)|forge]] by combining a [[dwarvish short sword]] and a pair of [[Gauntlets (EvilHack)|gauntlets]].

===SlashTHEM===
In [[SlashTHEM]], the [[militant cleric]] of the rebel party that serves as [[quest nemeses]] for the default [[Noble quest]] will generate with iron shoes.

===Hack'EM===
[[Hack'EM]] splits iron shoes into dwarvish and orcish boots similar to EvilHack.

[[Upgrading]] a pair of [[high boots]] will produce a pair of dwarvish boots. As in EvilHack, a pair of dwarvish boots can be created at a forge by combining a dwarvish short sword and a pair of gauntlets.
